entry.title: The Webb Space Telescope Will Rewrite Cosmic History. If It Works.
entry.content: The James Webb Space Telescope has the potential to rewrite the history of the cosmos and reshape humanity’s position within it. But first, a lot of things have to work just right.

entry.title: Quantum Simulators Create a Totally New Phase of Matter
entry.content: One of the first goals of quantum computing has been to recreate bizarre quantum systems that can’t be studied in an ordinary computer. A dark-horse quantum simulator has now done just that.

entry.title: The Algorithm That Lets Particle Physicists Count Higher Than Two
entry.content: Through his encyclopedic study of the electron, an obscure figure named Stefano Laporta found a handle on the subatomic world’s fearsome complexity. His algorithm has swept the field.

entry.title: How Quantum Computers Will Correct Their Errors
entry.content: Quantum bits are fussy and fragile. Useful quantum computers will need to use an error-correction technique like the one that was recently demonstrated on a real machine.
